intro: Gnaphaliothamnus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican thamnus, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow, hairy, and have a distinct aromatic scent.
